original_title: Sri Lanka’s state-run water board disconnects 87,000 consumers after 2022 tariff hike-official
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT- Sri Lanka’s state run water supplier has cut off water supply for 87,000 consumers who have failed to pay their monthly bill after a tariff hike last year, an official said.
“Up to now, we have disconnected 87,000 connections as consumers are unable to pay their bills”, an official from the state-owned National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) told Economy Next.
The NWSBD incurred a loss of 3.1 billion rupees in 2021 and the losses continued in 2022 as well due to lower revenue and higher wages of the employees.

“If the consumers don’t pay within the 30-day period, we are liable to disconnect. The issue is they are not prioritizing the due payment. Actually 50 percent of customers are not paying within 30 days but they are consuming water.”
A special gazette notification was issued by Water Supply Minister Keheliya Rambukwella to increase the water tariffs with effect from September 01, 2022
“The arrears for the disconnected customers are 1.7 billion. Normally we have 2 month bills that are 8 billion.” (Colombo/April01/2023)
